page.title: 10ECOLOGY - Cannock Chase SCC
page.content: Staffordshire County Council manages 3500 acres.It is open moorland covered in heather and bracken.They spray or burn the bracken to control it.Brocton Coppice is one of the few remaining areas of oak but there are some alders by the streams/pools and a lot of silver birch along roadsides.Some of the Wardens collect the acorns and sow them in pots to grow in a nursery.The animals would eat them if they didnt and there would be no oak trees. There are 300/400 Red deer and Fallow deer with a few Muntjack.Many deer are killed in road accidents so only a few are culled to maintain a number balance There are only 15 Badger setts on the Chase.There are foxes and rabbits in high numbers,many grey squirrels and a few red which are being encouraged with nesting boxes.The Chase has kestrels and nightjars.(M.Clegg Age8)
